intro: Pectis caymanensis, commonly known as the Cayman Islands pectis, is a flowering plant native to the Cayman Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in spherical heads. Pectis caymanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and limited distribution.
